summary: This bill, the Gabriel Rosenberg Dyspraxia/DCD Coverage Act, mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on insurance coverage for dyspraxia/developmental coordination disorder (DCD). The study will analyze coverage under various health plans, including Medicare, Medicaid, and private insurance, and will provide a report to Congress. The report will examine coverage availability, types of services covered, age cutoffs, barriers to coverage, and compliance with existing laws. It will also offer recommendations for improved coverage and guidance from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.
